modules.description: Processes and manipulates GEDCOM lines by concatenating lists and trimming cross-reference markers. Parses and extracts components of names from strings, allowing retrieval of first, last, and title parts. Used to standardize and structure name data from GEDCOM records.

Prints individual GEDCOM lines and nodes in a structured format, preserving hierarchy and metadata. Operates on `gedcom_line` and `gedcom_node` types, which represent parsed GEDCOM entries and their associated data. Used to generate human-readable outputs for genealogical data analysis and debugging.

Processes GEDCOM format files by parsing and validating records, extracting individual and family data, and handling hierarchical structures. Operates on strings, lists, and custom record types representing GEDCOM elements. Enables tasks such as importing genealogical data, generating reports, and cross-referencing family relationships.

Processes and manipulates GEDCOM data by handling line concatenation, cross-reference trimming, and name component extraction, while also enabling structured output generation. It works with `gedcom_line` and `gedcom_node` types to represent and format parsed entries. Operations include standardizing names, preserving hierarchical relationships, and producing readable representations of genealogical data. For example, it can extract a person's last name from a raw GEDCOM string or display a node with its associated metadata in a clear format.
